abstract: Cyprus secures a bailout deal. | Banks lose a loophole | An F.C.C. shift may thwart a Murdoch media deal. | Buyers Circle Marks & Spencer as takeover target | A buyer is found for Blockbuster’s British unit.
snippet: Cyprus secures a bailout deal. | Banks lose a loophole | An F.C.C. shift may thwart a Murdoch media deal. | Buyers Circle Marks & Spencer as takeover target | A buyer is found for Blockbuster’s British unit.
lead_paragraph: |  RIVAL BIDS FOR DELL The bidding war for Dell is heating up. The computer maker confirmed on Monday that it had received preliminary takeover proposals by the private equity giant Blackstone Group and the investor Carl C. Icahn. As expected, the company’s special committee determined that “both proposals could reasonably be expected to result in superior proposals” and intended to keep negotiating with Blackstone and Mr. Icahn, DealBook’s Michael J. de la Merced reports.

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
